Japan's Move to Become Military Power Denounced in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Anti-Japan Action Network for Achieving Peace in Northeast Asia reportedly called a press conference in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul on Oct. 18 to bitterly denounce Japan's move to become a military power.
 At the conference speakers said that Japan's moves to escalate sanctions upon the DPRK and become a military giant would result in international isolation as they are a dangerous act of threatening peace in Northeast Asia including the Korean Peninsula.    
 They denounced Japan's unreasonable sanctions on the DPRK and move to become a military giant and strongly demanded their immediate stop.

articles.title: Repeal of NSL Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
U.S. War Moves Condemned in S. Korea 
   Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The Anti-U.S. Women's Society of south Korea reportedly issued a statement on Oct. 16 to evince its will to conduct a dynamic movement for peace against the U.S. war moves.
 The statement accused the U.S. of intensifying its hostile policy toward the DPRK in disregard of the demand of the international community for peace.    
 Japan's move to become a military power is getting more undisguised, the statement said, asserting that the U.S. and its follower Japan are chiefly to blame for the war crisis prevailing in the Korean Peninsula.

articles.title: Important Days of DPRK Observed in Peru
articles.content:
Repeal of NSL Urged in S. Korea
   Pyongyang, October 22 (KCNA) -- The Solidarity for Implementing the South-North Joint Declaration and the General Student Council of Hongik University in south Korea reportedly called a press conference in front of the Central District Court in Seoul on Oct. 17 to demand the release of Choe Hui Jong, permanent researcher of the south Korean Institute for Civil Rights Studies and abolition of the "National Security Law" (NSL).
 A press release read out at the conference said that the security authorities detained Choe Hui Jong on charges of the NSL violation before plotting to fabricate a "case of an organization behind the south Korean Federation of University Student Councils" (Hanchongryon) by dint of the Intelligence Service, security investigation corps and prosecution. It denounced this as a move to stamp out Hanchongryon.    
 The NSL, a leverage of crackdown on the progressive forces, should be abolished at an early date, the release stressed.
